result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

10:03 AM Defendant Khalil Jacari Perry appeared by video, in custody from Washington County.  Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski appeared by video for Khalil Jacari Perry.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is called to schedule a contested competency hearing. 
Defendant would prefer to attend by zoom, rather than being produced.
Court will require all parties to appear for the evidentiary hearing, including the Drs.
Atty. Ostrowski requests Defendant be produced that day rather than earlier. 
Clerk to produce an OTP for the day of the next hearing. 
State may file an adjournment request if there is a conflict.
Evidentiary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Evidentiary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Evidentiary hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Evidentiary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Letter from Attorney Ostrowski requesting to appear remotely by Zoom for the status hearing in this case.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/27/2022 - Approved.**
Per order of Judge Dorow, the defendant will appear via Zoom for the upcoming hearing and will not be produced.

Letter from Attorney Ostrowski regarding the competency report in this case, and requesting that the defendant be permitted to appear via Zoom for the upcoming hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/21/2022 - The Court is not inclined to appoint a second doctor at county expense and therefore denies the request without a hearing. The Court notes that Attorney Ostrowski works for the State of Wisconsin and the State Public Defender and, as such, must first seek approval from the SPD to hire a doctor to perform an evaluation of Mr. Perry before the Court would consider ordering a second evaluation. The court will address the scheduling of a contested competency hearing given that Mr. Perry does not agree with the findings on file. The OTP will be cancelled and Mr. Perry is to appear by zoom for the 9/28 hearing.**

filed by Dr. Deborah L. Collins.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/19/2022 - The Defense is to advise by 9/21/22 whether there is going to be an objection to the report of Dr. Collins and a hearing on the issue of competency requested.**
Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed by CC Costello on 09/02/2022.

8:15 AM Defendant Khalil Jacari Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski in court for Khalil Jacari Perry.  Attorney Michael Thurston in court for State of Wisconsin. 

DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. 
Due to a trial set in Judge Dorow's Court, all of October, the parties request to have the matter set at the end of September to see if the report is filed.
The Court notes that there is a date set on September 23, 2022 and will reschedule that date to end of September.
The Court will set the matter in front the Trial Court.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODEUCED FROM WASHINGTON COUNTY DETENTION CENTER FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Copy of Motion to Stay Adult Court Proceedings During the Pendency of the Waiver Appeal sent to the Court of Appeals by Atty Ostrowski

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/09/2022--This Court has already heard a motion for stay pending appeal, and granted a 90 day extension. This motion seeks to extend the 90 day period. Because this Court interprets the motion as a motion for reconsideration and the appropriate legal standard has not been argued, let alone met, the Motion is denied without a hearing. THIS IS A FINAL ORDER FOR PURPOSES OF APPEAL.**
to Stay Trial Proceedings filed by Atty. Nicole Ostrowski.

Detainer placed at: Washington County Secure Detention Facility
Hearing on May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim/ Witness Key signed by Judge Dorow
Filed by Atty Ostrowski for request for zoom.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Waukesha Public Library listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1.0 mile of Victim A/Waukesha Public Library, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

01:05 PM Defendant Khalil Jacari Perry in court, in custody, from Washington County Secure Detention Facility with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Ostrowski notes she filed documents with the Juvenile Court and intends on filing the same documents with this Court asking for a stay on all proceedings pending a decision on said motion.  Attorney Ostrowski further notes she filed a motion staying the order waiving the defendant to adult court and that matter will be heard on May 2, 2022 at 9:30 a.m. before Judge Lazar.  Attorney Ostrowski is asking for this matter to be set over for a new date.  Attorney Thurston notes the State is ready to proceed with the initial appearance and acknowledges receipt of the documents filed by Attorney Ostrowski.  Attorney Thurston will leave it in the Court's discretion.  Attorney Ostrowski further argues her request to adjourn the initial appearance until after her motion is heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court denies Attorney Ostrowski's request and will proceed with the initial appearance.  Attorney Ostrowski is asking to set this matter for a status of the preliminary hearing.  The Court will set this matter for a status and make arrangements for the defendant to appear by Zoom from Washington County Secure Detention Facility.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order Waiving Juvenile Court Jurisdiction - signed by Judge Lazar
